website_summaries.verdict: High quality cycling shorts that receive top marks from long-distance cyclists to spin class goers.
pros: Popular for comfort – not too tight, but supportive
So well-liked that some reviewers ordered more than one pair
cons: A little on the short side for long-legged women
Ride up the thigh for some

customer_reviews.title: They fit perfect. Wore them on RAGBRAI (weeklong bike ride across ...
customer_reviews.text: I am 5' 8.5", 145 lb, and ordered a medium. They fit perfect. Wore them on RAGBRAI (weeklong bike ride across Iowa, 50-75 miles per day) and they were my favorite of all my cycling shorts. The material was very comfortable. I also liked the length of the short, and the fact that they did NOT have grippers on the legs. I had no issue with them riding up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit a little tight on thighs but good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality...a little tight on the thighs but I guess it depends on how big your legs are. Mine are small, but I guess many bikers are very lean. I'm 135 and 5'6 and ordered a small. I would have liked to try a medium but these are fine.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Trump

customer_reviews.title: Fit and function on these are great, but note that the grey color does show ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit and function on these are great, but note that the grey color does show sweat, and since they are bike shorts, the sweat accumulates in the crotch. Five minutes of riding and I look like I wet my pants. For a hardcore training day, who cares. But probably not the shorts you want to wear to do a social ride with the kids.
customer_reviews.author: TannyB

customer_reviews.title: These have the best and most comfortable padding of any bike shorts I ...
customer_reviews.text: These have the best and most comfortable padding of any bike shorts I have ever worn and I've worn quite a few. The fabric is great too, not too thin nor too thick. The only down side is that the legs have nothing to keep them in place so they ride up and since they're already short in the legs they look a bit ridiculous on my aging legs. So two improvements needed, longer legs and something to make the legs stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: C E Perry

customer_reviews.title: Great shorts
customer_reviews.text: I ride long and these are great. They are stretchy enough that when you are soaking wet they are easy to pull down and up. That is a huge bonus for me. They are comfortable up to 100 miles ( I have not ridden more). I bought all three colors after I had worn on pair on a couple long rides. I have all brands and these, for me, are by far the most superior -- do not feel the "diaper" at all.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Buy these ones!
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable bike shorts I own. Generous chamois, waist and leg openings do not constrict or cause sausage legs or muffin top, soft fabric, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Nosenbk

customer_reviews.title: Nice shorter short
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this cycling shorts! I'm always on the hunt for shorter cycling shorts that have a good chamois since my sit bones are always bruised. The chamois in these is not the thickest I've used, but it is so comfortable. I get the shorter short (tan line placement is important when you ride a lot) with the comfort I need. The longest ride I've gone on in these is 50 miles and my sit bones didn't feel quite as bruised.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Jones

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite riding shorts
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'7, 145lbs and I purchased a medium and they fit great.....These are amazing. I have a few pairs of a shorts and these by far are the best. They feel like pajamas on and the material is super soft. I did a typical 20 miler in them and normally my bottom would be sore and with these is really seemed to prevent most of that. Therefore I feel the padding is up to par! they stayed put the entire time and didn't roll town in the tummy area which I usually have an issue with.. I will be buying another pair!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: PERFECTION!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING! I am so happy with these bike shorts. I am 5’8” and around 135 with a good amount of muscle and these shorts are perfect. I ordered a small. They are so, so comfy. I ride around 100-120 miles per week (I ride 4 days a week). The padding is pretty good. I am kind of bony so my seat bones get sore, but these shorts mitigate it pretty well. I love every thing about them. I’m sure I’ll be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Limbird

customer_reviews.title: Very very pleased with these shorts
customer_reviews.text: Very very pleased with these shorts! Super comfortable, and great. I used these for my last 8 weeks of ironman training. They are great, but I do think they wore out quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: The right length and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I tried several bike pants and liked this material the most. I was looking for one that wasn’t too thin even though I know it’s common for bikers to look for breathable material. I have worn this pants during 95-100F weather for about 20-30mi. It was still breathable, soft and comfy. I also needed one that wasn’t too long (avoiding obvious tan line). The waist height was good such that it wasn’t folding and neither does it bite into my muffin top. Definitely not the cheapest but it gave me the most comfort. Instead of getting two pairs of pants, I could only get one
customer_reviews.author: ocrandom

I find that since there's so gripper on the legs, I have to work up a sweat for the legs to stay put. Otherwise a bit of sunblock on the legs will keep them in place.

product_meta.title: Louis Garneau Women's Fit Sensor 5.5 Bike Shorts, Padded and Breathable
feature_bullets: The Airzone integrated chamois is made from high-density perforated memory foam that eliminates pinching and chafing. It's breathable, moisture wicking, antibacterial, and comfortable.
COMPRESSIVE: The Powerband compressive cuffs reduce lower leg pressure and support without restricting circulation.
COMFORTABLE: The seamless inner legs and flatlock seams offer enhanced comfort.
PRACTICAL: Brushed back fabric enhances moisture wicking and body heat thermoregulation while the HuggFit waist is flattering and keeps the garment in place.
VISIBLE: Features reflective accents for more visibility in low light.
